author: Gregory Fletcher
title: FFRF chides Fla. lt. gov. for her ‚Äòvoting like atheists‚Äô speech
text: The [Freedom From Religion Foundation is calling out Florida Lt. Gov. Jeanette N√∫√±ez](https://ffrf.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Lt.-Gov.-Jeanette-Nun%CC%83ez-FL-1.pdf) after her recent comment at an anti-abortion rally deriding people who ‚Äúvote like atheists.‚Äù FFRF learned of a ‚Äúcampaign-like rally‚Äù on Monday where N√∫√±ez and Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis appeared in their official capacities to oppose Amendment 4, a pro-legal abortion amendment on the Florida ballot. At the event, [N√∫√±ez remarked](https://apnews.com/article/abortion-ron-desantis-florida-election-2024-6fa32787580e935a819248504345cb3c), ‚ÄúWe cannot go to church and pray like Christians and turn around and vote like atheists.‚Äù FFRF blasted her insulting implication that it is wrong to ‚Äúvote like an atheist,‚Äù and also her false assumption that Christians in general don‚Äôt support reproductive freedom. ‚ÄúWhile your remarks were intended to denigrate atheists and promote your own Christian beliefs, in fact we would suggest that our country would be a whole lot better off if more people ‚Äòvoted like an atheist,‚Äô‚Äù FFRF Co-Presidents [Annie Laurie Gaylor and Dan Barker have written to N√∫√±ez](https://ffrf.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Lt.-Gov.-Jeanette-Nun%CC%83ez-FL-1.pdf), citing surveys showing the humanistic voter values of atheists and other nonreligious Americans. They also cited statistics showing that abortion rights are favored by a majority of America‚Äôs faithful, even Catholics and Mormons, with the exception of white evangelicals and similar strains. FFRF requested that in future N√∫√±ez refrain from using her elected position as lieutenant governor to denigrate minority beliefs on religion while promoting her own personal religious beliefs. She‚Äôs free to practice her religion in her personal capacity, but not to abuse her authority as a government official to turn one class ‚Äî her kind of Christian ‚Äî into a favored class, and turn another class ‚Äî atheists ‚Äî into a disfavored class. As lieutenant governor of Florida, N√∫√±ez is tasked with upholding the U.S. Constitution ‚Äî including the First Amendment‚Äôs Establishment Clause. N√∫√±ez serves a diverse state that consists not only of Christians, but also Jewish, Muslim, atheist and other non-Christian constituents. When she promotes Christianity through official communications, she marginalizes and excludes many of her constituents. A full [37 percent](https://www.pewforum.org/2021/12/14/about-three-in-ten-u-s-adults-are-now-religiously-unaffiliated/) of Americans are non-Christian, including nearly one-in-three Americans on a national level who are religiously unaffiliated. The religiously unaffiliated specifically comprise [26 percent](https://ava.prri.org/#religious/2022/States/religion/m/US-FL) of Florida‚Äôs population. ‚ÄúPlease start honoring the secular Constitution you took an oath to uphold,‚Äù FFRF concludes. The Freedom From Religion Foundation is a national nonprofit organization with 40,000 members and several chapters across the country, including 2,000 members and the Central Florida Freethought Community chapter in Florida. Its purposes are to protect the constitutional principle of separation between state and church, and to educate the public on matters relating to nontheism.

author: Redazione
title: Annuncia di volersi suicidare in una piattaforma online, la storia di un giovane catanese e l‚Äôintervento della polizia
text:
Ha inviato un messaggio all‚Äôutente con cui stava giocando on line sostenendo di voler compiere un gesto estremo . Ravvisata la gravit√† delle intenzioni, il destinatario del messaggio, un coetaneo residente all‚Äôestero, ha pensato subito di dare l‚Äôallarme e la Sala Operativa Interpol ha inviato alla Sala Operativa della Questura di Catania una nota di rintraccio per il giovane, un 17enne di Patern√≤.
L‚Äôannuncio L‚Äôutente ha spiegato ai poliziotti che, dopo aver giocato in una nota piattaforma di gaming on line, ha scambiato diversi messaggi con il 17enne paternese fino a quando non √® sorto un alterco virtuale tra i due e, colto da una crisi di nervi, il ragazzo ha manifestato intenti suicidi.
Raccolta la segnalazione dell‚ÄôInterpol, la Questura di Catania ha immediatamente attivato gli agenti del Commissariato di Pubblica Sicurezza di Adrano per verificare l‚Äôattendibilit√† del contenuto della segnalazione ed evitare possibili tragici epiloghi.
L‚Äôintervento I poliziotti hanno raggiunto prima l‚Äôindirizzo segnalato e, non trovando il giovane, hanno raccolto alcune necessarie informazioni dai condomini dello stabile che hanno spiegato come, in realt√†, il ragazzo si trovava domiciliato con la madre. Giunti all‚Äôabitazione della donna, gli agenti del Commissariato di Adrano hanno trovato il ragazzo che si trovava in compagnia della madre e appariva assolutamente tranquillo e in buona salute.
Dopo aver spiegato la ragione della loro presenza e sentita la versione dei fatti, che confermava quanto accaduto tra i giovani gamer, i poliziotti hanno sensibilizzato il giovane ad evitare, in futuro, di tenere condotte tali da creare allarme e apprensione.
Il salvataggio a Palermo Gli agenti di polizia delle volanti hanno salvato un uomo che lasciato dalla compagna voleva gettarsi dal ponte nei pressi del Baby Luna a Palermo lungo viale Regione Siciliana.
L‚Äôuomo aveva scritto una lettera d‚Äôaddio nella quale affermava che senza la donna non poteva pi√π vivere. Inizialmente si era tenuto anche il peggio. La paura che l‚Äôuomo in preda ad uno stato di delirio e di convulsioni che gi√† aveva scavalcato la recinzione avesse aggredito la compagnia prima di togliersi la vita.
Fortunatamente la donna √® stata contattata, stava bene e non sapeva nulla di quanto stava accadendo al ponte Corleone. Gli agenti si sono concentrati sull‚Äôuomo. Hanno cercato di calmarlo e poi sono riusciti a bloccarlo evitando che l‚Äôuomo compisse l‚Äôestremo gesto.
Una volta bloccato l‚Äôuomo √® stato affidato ai sanitari del 118 che lo hanno trasportato in ospedale dove √® stato ricoverato.

author: Madison Williams
title: Eagles O-Line Had Giddy Reaction to Jalen Hurts, Saquon Barkley Gifting Golf Carts
text:
Eagles O-Line Had Giddy Reaction to Jalen Hurts, Saquon Barkley Gifting Golf Carts
NFL quarterbacks often surprise their offensive linemen with pretty awesome gifts for Christmas each year, and they continue to be more extravagant year after year.
[Philadelphia Eagles](https://www.si.com/nfl/team/philadelphia-eagles) quarterback Jalen Hurts, along with running back Saquon Barkley, teamed up to gift their offensive lineman all golf carts for the holiday season. The sides of the golf carts all had the players' names and numbers on them.
The offensive linemen ran outside of the practice facility and thanked Hurts and Barkley before checking out their new wheels. They all giddily ran to the golf carts and began honking the horns, as one does. Some players even test drove theirs. Hurts and Barkley loved watching their teammates enjoy their new gifts.
Hurts may have drawn inspiration from [Kansas City Chiefs](https://www.si.com/nfl/team/kansas-city-chiefs) quarterback Patrick Mahomes, [who gifted his offensive linemen with golf carts last season](https://www.si.com/nfl/2023/12/21/patrick-mahomes-gifts-line-golf-carts-christmas-arrowhead). Those were red with the players' names and numbers on them.

author: Terry McKiernan
title: Bishop Willie Walsh, who undertook pilgrimage to apologise to Church's abuse victims, dies aged 90
text:
Bishop Emeritus Willie Walsh has died at the age of 90.
He was widely viewed as a progressive figure within the Catholic Church and the current Bishop of Killaloe said there is a ‚Äúprofound sadness‚Äù at his passing.
Walsh died last night and funeral arrangements will follow later.
He served as the Bishop of the Killaloe Diocese for 16 years, before submitting his resignation to Pope Benedict XVI upon reaching the retirement age of 75 in 2010.
Walsh was ordained a priest in 1959 and also taught in St Flannan‚Äôs in Ennis.
Walsh made headlines in 1999 when he embarked on a three-week ‚ÄúPilgrimage of Reconciliation‚Äù which involved him walking to each church in his diocese to apologise for child sexual abuse scandals within the Church.
The Killaloe Diocese said Walsh ‚Äúundertook to walk across the Diocese from Loop Head to Kinnity as a sign of solidarity and repentance to all who had been hurt‚Äù.
And in 2015, Walsh hit out at the Vatican for claiming that the passing of the marriage equality referendum in Ireland was a ‚Äúdefeat for humanity‚Äù.
These remarks were made by the Vatican‚Äôs Secretary of State Cardinal Pietro Parolin, who said: ‚ÄúI think that you cannot just talk of a defeat for Christian principles, but of a defeat for humanity.‚Äù
Walsh told RT√â Radio that this was an ‚Äúinappropriate statement‚Äù and he added that it was ‚Äúnot one I think that represents the mind of Pope Francis despite it coming from a very senior Church figure‚Äù.
Walsh added that Parolin‚Äôs comments made him ‚Äúuncomfortable‚Äù and said: ‚ÄúThere has been lots of disasters in the world but I certainly would not support the belief that the referendum was among them.‚Äù
Meanwhile, Walsh also voiced support for Catholic priests to be able to marry.
In a 2005 interview with the now defunct Sunday Tribune, Walsh said that there was ‚Äúroom for both priests who are married and celibate priests in our Church‚Äù.
He also voiced concern in the interview that the Catholic Church was losing ‚Äúsome very fine priests‚Äù who had left the priesthood due to the need to remain celibate.
‚ÄúUnless in some way celibacy is a generous gift to others and to God, it is meaningless,‚Äù said Walsh.
‚ÄúIf we see celibacy simply as abstaining from sexual intimacy, then it is negative, not life-giving.‚Äù
There are some married priests within the Catholic Church, though the number is very small.
This is the result of a policy change made by Pope John Paul II in 1980, which offered a path for married Episcopal and Anglican priests to continue their ministry after converting to Catholicism.
In a statement today, the current Bishop of Killaloe, Bishop Fintan Monahan, remarked that there is a ‚Äúprofound sadness‚Äù in the diocese following Walsh‚Äôs death.
‚ÄúHe was dearly loved by the many whose lives he touched in his extraordinary pastoral ministry,‚Äù said Monahan.
Monahan remarked that Walsh‚Äôs motto was the ‚ÄúGentleness of Christ‚Äù and that his ministry ‚Äúradiated that in his care for the poor, pastoral support to survivors of abuse, to anyone who was in trouble, and anyone struggling in life‚Äù.

author: VNExplorer
title: Eleven police officers killed in Pakistan ambush
text: Pakistan authorities vowed swift revenge after the attack in Rahim Yar Khan district - Rahat Dar/EPA-EFE/Shutterstock Armed men ambushed a military convoy in eastern Pakistan on Thursday, killing at least 11 police officers and injuring seven others. Police officials told local media that two vans, carrying more than 20 officers, were trapped in rainwater when the ‚Äúbandits‚Äù launched rockets at them. The convoy came under attack in the Rahim Yar Khan district in a remote area while returning from routine duties aimed at targeting robbers in the region. Maryam Nawaz, the Punjab chief minister, condemned the attack and vowed that it would not go ‚Äúunavenged‚Äù. She said that her team of officials was dispatched with ‚Äúclear directions to sort them out decisively‚Äù. ‚ÄúSacrifices of police personnel will always be remembered,‚Äù she said, instructing the authorities to take immediate action to recover the missing officers. Shehbaz Sharif, Pakistan‚Äôs prime minister, ordered ‚Äúimmediate and effective action‚Äù against those responsible for the attack. Asif Ali Zardari, the country‚Äôs president, also condemned it. Murad Ali Shah, the neighbouring Sindh province chief minister, offered support to treat the injured officers. ‚ÄúSindh, Punjab and Balochistan police should plan a joint operation against dacoits,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúPunjab police are as brave as Sindh police, both have always fought against terrorism and dacoits,‚Äù he added. The armed groups in the region have consistently posed challenges to the provincial governments of Sindh and Punjab, despite numerous operations aimed at eradicating them. In April, a review committee of the National Action Plan decided to launch a joint operation by the police forces in the area. Earlier on Thursday, gunmen opened fire on a school bus in the Attock district of the same region, killing two children, according to the police. The attack left five other children wounded on their way to school with some as young as five years old. Police said the attack seemed to be aimed at the driver, who was also injured. Attock district is near Pakistan‚Äôs volatile north west where attacks by armed groups have surged in recent years. In 2014, Pakistani Taliban gunmen attacked a military run school in the region, killing nearly 150 children. author: Victoria Torres Benayas
title: El tiempo: Baleares, Catalu√±a y Comunidad Valenciana siguen un d√≠a m√°s bajo aviso por la dana | Espa√±a | EL PA√çS
text: La fase m√°s terrible de la dana ha pasado ya, tras cobrarse la vida de m√°s de 200 personas , pero la situaci√≥n adversa contin√∫a durante el fin de semana e incluso el lunes, seg√∫n advierte la Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a (Aemet) . As√≠, este s√°bado proseguir√° la inestabilidad en el Mediterr√°neo, con chubascos ‚Äúde nuevo fuertes y persistentes en el sur de Catalu√±a, tambi√©n en la Comunidad Valenciana y en el archipi√©lago balear que, de forma m√°s d√©bil, se podr√°n registrar en puntos del tercio sur de la Pen√≠nsula‚Äù, seg√∫n pronostica Rub√©n del Campo, portavoz de Aemet. En el mapa de avisos, Aemet ha levantado el que pesaba desde el viernes sobre Baleares, pero lo ha activado de nuevo en Andaluc√≠a. As√≠, el aviso es naranja, el segundo nivel de una escala de tres, en Catalu√±a (Tarragona, Girona y Barcelona) y Comunidad Valenciana (Castell√≥n), y amarillo en Andaluc√≠a (Granada). En algunas zonas pueden llover a un ritmo de 40 litros por metro cuadrado a la hora y, en otras, llegar a acumularse de 100 en 12 horas. Marivent @DuncanWingen üé• pic.twitter.com/o28k1uoJbm A partir del domingo, indica Del Campo ‚Äúla tendencia es a que la dana poco a poco vaya desapareciendo y a que la situaci√≥n sea m√°s estable‚Äù. La fase m√°s adversa del temporal estaba prevista en un principio hasta el jueves, ‚Äúpero es normal en situaciones como esta que se alarguen un poco‚Äù, explica el experto. As√≠, el domingo habr√° que estar ‚Äúatentos porque todav√≠a ser√° una nueva jornada con inestabilidad en todo el Mediterr√°neo, desde Catalu√±a hasta el Estrecho y Baleares‚Äù. Adem√°s, en la zona del sur de Tarragona, norte de Castell√≥n y puntos de Teruel, la misma de este viernes, podr√≠a haber tambi√©n tormentas fuertes o con persistencia. Estar√°n bajo aviso por lluvias Comunidad Valenciana y Catalu√±a, ambas en amarillo . Andaluc√≠a tiene aviso amarillo, pero por mala mar. Los chubascos podr√°n ser fuertes todav√≠a el lunes, especialmente en el sur de Catalu√±a, en la Comunidad Valenciana y en el sur de Arag√≥n. De cara al martes y a los d√≠as siguientes, probablemente habr√° una situaci√≥n m√°s estable, en todo el pa√≠s, pero a d√≠a de hoy todav√≠a no se pueden descartar posibles chubascos una vez m√°s en el √°rea mediterr√°nea. Las temperaturas estos d√≠as ‚Äúno van a variar demasiado y que ser√°n en general algo m√°s c√°lidas de lo habitual para esta √©poca del a√±o‚Äù. ¬øPor qu√© est√°s viendo esto?

author: Diario La Tribuna
title: Mujeres hondure√±as conmemoran su d√≠a exigiendo justicia y el fin de la violencia machista
text:
Mujeres hondure√±as conmemoran su d√≠a exigiendo justicia y el fin de la violencia machista
Decenas de mujeres conmemoraron este jueves el D√≠a de la Mujer Hondure√±a con movilizaciones para reclamar justicia y el fin de la violencia machista en Honduras, donde 380 murieron en 2023, as√≠ como la impunidad que rodea esos casos.
El color morado en banderas y camisetas predomin√≥ durante la jornada en Tegucigalpa, donde participaron organizaciones feministas como la Asociaci√≥n Calidad de Vida, la Plataforma 25 de Noviembre y el Centro de Derechos de Mujeres (CDM).
El principal clamor de las manifestantes en su d√≠a fue ‚Äújusticia‚Äù para los casos de feminicidios en Honduras, donde 380 mujeres murieron en 2023 y 16 en los primeros quince d√≠as de 2024.
‚ÄúPersisten las denuncias por violencia dom√©stica en todo el pa√≠s, pero solamente Tegucigalpa, San Pedro Sula y La Ceiba (centro, norte y Caribe) cuentan con Juzgados Especializados contra la Violencia Dom√©stica, lo que evidencia la discriminaci√≥n institucionalizada y la falta de acceso a la justicia para las mujeres‚Äù, denunci√≥ un grupo de mujeres durante un plant√≥n en la Corte Suprema de Justicia (CSJ).
Las mujeres pidieron ‚Äúla urgente‚Äù aprobaci√≥n de la Ley de Casas Refugio, presentada en 2018, para v√≠ctimas de la violencia machista en Honduras.
‚ÄúNo queremos flores, queremos justicia para las mujeres‚Äù, ‚ÄúAlto a los feminicidios‚Äù, ‚ÄúNo quiero ser una cifra‚Äù, fueron algunas de las consignas le√≠das en carteles y mantas que mostraron las manifestantes.
Medidas urgentes contra violencia de g√©nero
Otro grupo de mujeres se moviliz√≥ hacia la parte baja del edificio del Parlamento hondure√±o, en el centro de Tegucigalpa, para reclamar ‚Äúmedidas urgentes‚Äù para erradicar todo tipo de violencia contra ellas.
Las mujeres merecen ‚Äúvivir sin miedo a que nos maten, a que nos violen, a que ejerzan violencia pol√≠tica contra nosotras, a sentirnos seguras en nuestras casas y transitar tranquilas por sitios p√∫blicos‚Äù, se√±al√≥ la Plataforma 25 de Noviembre, que aglutina a una veintena de organizaciones feministas.
Los accesos al Parlamento fueron acordonados hoy por decenas de polic√≠as por la ceremonia de instalaci√≥n del tercer per√≠odo de sesiones de la legislatura 2022-2026, a la que asisti√≥ la presidenta hondure√±a, Xiomara Castro, quien felicit√≥ a las mujeres de su pa√≠s.
El machismo, la indiferencia y el silencio ‚Äúmatan y roban los sue√±os de las mujeres‚Äù, enfatiz√≥ la Plataforma 25 de Noviembre, que reclam√≥ la aprobaci√≥n de la ley Integral en contra de la violencia hacia ellas.
Las mujeres destacaron que tras 69 a√±os de una de sus conquistas m√°s importantes en la vida pol√≠tica del pa√≠s: que se les reconociera el derecho a votar en las elecciones generales, siguen ‚Äúresistiendo‚Äù.
Lamentaron adem√°s que sigan ‚Äúsiendo v√≠ctimas de un patr√≥n de poder patriarcal, capitalista y colonialista‚Äù y de un sistema que ‚Äúexplota, tortura, viola, mata, cosifica, ignora y sigue decidiendo sobre los cuerpos y vidas de las mujeres‚Äù.
El asesinato de mujeres en Honduras ha generado en los √∫ltimos d√≠as un repudio generalizado en el pa√≠s y pedidos de varios sectores nacionales e internacionales a combatir la violencia y la impunidad que rodea esos casos.
La coordinadora residente de las Naciones Unidas en Honduras, Alice Shackelford, pidi√≥ hoy ‚Äúunir esfuerzos‚Äù para eliminar la violencia machista en el pa√≠s, donde una mujer muere de forma violenta cada 23 horas.
La Uni√≥n Europea (UE) y sus Estados miembros en Honduras (Alemania, Espa√±a y Francia) indicaron el mi√©rcoles que la violencia de g√©nero ‚Äúse ha acentuado‚Äù en el pa√≠s e instaron a las autoridades a que ‚Äúla impunidad deje de ser un elemento perpetuador de la violencia de g√©nero y atropello a los derechos de las mujeres‚Äù. efe

author: David Faris
title: Brendan Carr, Trump's FCC pick, takes aim at Big Tech
text: The next FCC commissioner wants to end content moderation practices on social media sites David Faris On November 17, President-elect Donald Trump nominated Brendan Carr to chair the Federal Communications Commission (FCC), the independent agency that regulates and oversees the nation's communications networks. Carr, who was appointed by Trump as an FCC commissioner in 2017, has been an outspoken critic of content moderation efforts on social media networks like X and Facebook, likening them to censorship regimes, and is expected to target tech giants for regulatory action. A familiar career trajectory Carr has spent virtually his entire life in Washington, D.C. Born in the nation's capital, Carr attended Georgetown University, where he graduated with a BA in Government in 2001. He pursued a legal career by enrolling at the Columbus School of Law at the Catholic University of America in D.C. and graduated with a J.D. in 2005. His first job out of law school was at the D.C.-based law firm Wiley Rein , where he specialized in telecommunications law. From 2007 to 2008, he clerked on the Fourth Circuit Court of Appeals before returning to Wiley Rein. Clerks serve in research, advisory and support roles for judges, and federal clerkships are the most prestigious of such posts in the legal world. That's because "from a purely resum√©-enhancing perspective, a clerkship also bestows upon a newer attorney a stamp of approval that opens doors to opportunities at prestigious law firms and government agencies and in academia," said the Federal Bar Association in a 2020 blog post. Trump picked Carr for a five-year term on the FCC in 2017, and because he has already been confirmed by the Senate, he requires no further action to move into the role of chair. President Biden renominated Carr as a commissioner in 2023. If that seems puzzling, it is because no more than three commissioners can be members of the same political party. Subscribe to The Week Escape your echo chamber. Get the facts behind the news, plus analysis from multiple perspectives. SUBSCRIBE & SAVE Sign up for The Week's Free Newsletters From our morning news briefing to a weekly Good News Newsletter, get the best of The Week delivered directly to your inbox. From our morning news briefing to a weekly Good News Newsletter, get the best of The Week delivered directly to your inbox. Carr's agenda Carr wrote a chapter of the Heritage Foundation's much-discussed Project 2025 manual called "Mandate For Leadership: The Conservative Promise." In Chapter 28 , titled "Federal Communications Commission," Carr recommends that the FCC should take aim at "big tech" and rein in some of its alleged abuses. He also recommends that the FCC stop interpreting Section 230 of the 1996 Communications Decency Act as conferring limitless immunity on media platforms for the content that they carry. Carr additionally believes that companies like Meta are suppressing conservative speech . "We must dismantle the censorship cartel and restore free speech rights for everyday Americans," Carr said in a post on X the day he was nominated to chair the FCC. Not everyone believes that it will be that easy. "I don't believe the FCC has the authority to do this," said Chamber of Progress CEO Adam Kovacevich to Roll Call , referring to Project 2025's Section 230 reforms. Congress should "empower consumers to choose their own content filters and fact checkers, if any," Carr said in his Project 2025 manual. Carr also thinks that the FCC should ban the social media platform TikTok and expand its " Covered List " of companies that should be prohibited from doing business in the U.S. for national security reasons. In addition, Carr has criticized the Biden administration for rejecting a bid to use federal subsidies to expand broadband access through Trump-aligned billionaire Elon Musk's Starlink platform. Carr applauded Musk's controversial 2022 acquisition of Twitter and is expected to deliver federal grants to the tech mogul. Carr is also planning to change the agency's internal practices. "Starting next year, the FCC will end its promotion of DEI," Carr said in a post https://twitter.com/BrendanCarrFCC/status/1858364209626521911. Carr's appointment was met with criticism from the left. "Brendan Carr has been campaigning for this job with promises to do the bidding of Donald Trump and Elon Musk," said Free Press Action co-CEO Craig Aaron to The Washington Post. But his fellow FCC commissioners welcomed the news. "Commissioner Carr is a dedicated public servant and a recognized leader on the many issues before the Commission today," said Democratic Commissioner Geoffrey Starks in a statement . Elon Musk congratulated Carr https://x.com/elonmusk/status/1858312453752328590 immediately after his appointment was announced. Sign up for Today's Best Articles in your inbox A free daily email with the biggest news stories of the day ‚Äì and the best features from TheWeek.com David Faris is an associate professor of political science at Roosevelt University and the author of It's Time to Fight Dirty: How Democrats Can Build a Lasting Majority in American Politics. He is a frequent contributor to Informed Comment, and his work has appeared in the Chicago Sun-Times, The Christian Science Monitor, and Indy Week. - ATACMS, the long-range American missiles being fired by Ukraine The Explainer President Joe Biden has authorized their use for the first time in the war By Justin Klawans, The Week US Published - The bacterial consequences of hurricanes Under the radar Floodwaters are microbial hotbeds By Devika Rao, The Week US Published - Crossword: November 22, 2024 The Week's daily crossword puzzle By The Week Staff Published - 'This needs to be a bigger deal' Instant Opinion Opinion, comment and editorials of the day By Justin Klawans, The Week US Published - The political latitude of Musk's cost-cutting task force Talking Points A $2 trillion goal. And big obstacles in the way. By Joel Mathis, The Week US Published - 'Rahmbo, back from Japan, will be looking for a job? Really?' Instant Opinion Opinion, comment and editorials of the day By Justin Klawans, The Week US Published - New York DA floats 4-year Trump sentencing freeze Speed Read President-elect Donald Trump's sentencing is on hold, and his lawyers are pushing to dismiss the case while he's in office By Rafi Schwartz, The Week US Published - 'It may not be surprising that creative work is used without permission' Instant Opinion Opinion, comment and editorials of the day By Justin Klawans, The Week US Published - What message is Trump sending with his Cabinet picks? TODAY'S BIG QUESTION By nominating high-profile loyalists like Matt Gaetz and RFK Jr., is Trump serious about creating a functioning Cabinet, or does he have a different plan in mind? author: La redacci√≥n
title: La Jornada - Desplazados de Chiapas alertan ‚Äúguerra muy fuerte‚Äù entre c√°rteles del narco
text:
Pobladores de municipios de la sierra de Chiapas hicieron un llamado de ‚Äúayuda urgente‚Äù, ya que los enfrentamientos entre grupos del narcotr√°fico que se disputan el territorio han ocasionado en las semanas recientes ‚Äúuna guerra muy fuerte‚Äù, lo que ha provocado un √©xodo de lugare√±os.
‚ÄúSomos vecinos de varios ejidos del municipio de Frontera Comalapa que pudimos salir de nuestras comunidades. Vivimos el terror de parte de grupos que les llaman delincuencia organizada, pero que sabemos son carteles que est√°n en guerra desde ya varios meses‚Äù, afirmaron en un comunicado.
‚ÄúEstos carteles secuestran, asesinan, y nos amenazan. En estas semanas la guerra est√° muy fuerte, lo que ha provocado que nos movamos de nuestras comunidades, que son varias como Paso Hondo, Santa Rita, Verapaz, 24 de febrero, Tampico, Bella Vista del Norte, Barrio Nueva Delicias, Guadalupe Grijalva, La Sabinada, ejido Tres Maravillas, Anonal, Nuevo Comalapa y Barrio Monteverde‚Äù, entre otros, agregaron.
Manifestaron que ‚Äúdel municipio de Amatenango de la Frontera, se han movido habitantes del Ejido Nueva Morelia, Rancher√≠a Michoac√°n, Ejido Pacayalito, Barrio Bienestar Social, Barrio Nueva Libertad, Barrio Flor de Mayo, Ejido Nuevo Recuerdo, Ejido Palestina, Ejido Nuevo Amatenango, Barrio Bel√©n, Barrio Platanillo, Barrio el Pino y del Barrio Nueva Am√©rica, por mencionar algunos ejidos y barrios‚Äù.
Aseguraron que ‚Äúlos carteles se llevan a hombres, mujeres y ni√±os; por eso estamos huyendo, ya sea fuera de nuestras tierras, incluso en lugares seguros para que nos podamos proteger de tanta violencia, palabra que se queda corta por los que desaparecen y mueren‚Äù.
Afirmaron que este mi√©rcoles, ‚Äúreportaron vecinos de los ejidos de Paso Hondo y Bella Vista del Norte, municipio de Frontera Comalapa, que uno de los grupos del crimen organizado entr√≥ a sus ejidos llev√°ndose por la fuerza a m√°s de 60 personas hombres todos y amenazaron con regresar por m√°s gente‚Äù.
Subrayaron: ‚ÄúNecesitamos del apoyo de todos los sectores que conforman la sociedad civil, que nos ayuden porque queremos seguir vivos, trabajando y estar con tranquilidad. Los carteles nos controlan, nos impiden trabajar y adem√°s nos quitan lo poco que tenemos, adem√°s de que nos usan para sus propios intereses y no los de la comunidad‚Äù.
Concluyeron: ‚ÄúQueremos nos ayuden divulgando nuestra voz de auxilio, organiz√°ndose para presionar a las autoridades del estado de Chiapas, del gobierno federal y del Estado mexicano‚Äù.La Redacci√≥n
